column4: is there a way for me to configure my wifes laptop so that it will automatically connect to multiple access points when they're in range under gnome?
is there a way for me to configure my wifes laptop so that it will automatically connect to multiple access points when they're in range under gnome?
I had problems with it on my other laptop
yup, and sits in the tray
do you mean more than one at once?
no, I mean so that when she's at work, it connects to the work ap, and when she's at home, it will connect to the home ap
sudo apt-get install network-manager network-manager-gnome
Ill try that, isn't that the network applet that allows multiple "profiles"
how do I launch it?  it doesn't appear in my add to panel options, I remember having to launch it with flags from the command line the first time before too
nm-applet
it should be in your gnome startup now also
no problem
not sure why, but network applet wont actually configure the network card :(
have you clicked on it yet?
it shows the local networks, but wont' actually establish teh connection to mine, which is hidden and wep protected
yea, it SAYS connected but an ifconfig on the device shows otherwise
Connect to Other Wireless Network
I did, thats how I got my network in the list at all
networkmanager also seems to go through its own channels to connect.  see if you have a connection by pinging google or something
ifconfig reports no ip address assigned to my wireless card, or rather, the suspect 169._._._ addy
